{{Quote|Gail McIntosh was an absolute pleasure to work with. Once [[Iron Crown Enterprises|we]] had decided to put a bigger effort into our product covers—and therefore hopefully sell more products—Gail was an obvious choice; her studio was literally only blocks away from our first office, and she had already made a name for herself in the Charlottesville area.|Art Director [[Rick Britton]]<ref name=blackgate>{{Cite web|articleurl=https://www.blackgate.com/2011/11/23/art-of-the-genre-ices-middle-earth-roleplaying-part-one-gail-b-mcintosh/|articlename=Art of the Genre: I.C.E.’s Middle-Earth Roleplaying Part One, Gail B McIntosh|author=Scott Taylor|dated=2011|website=[https://www.blackgate.com Black Gate]}}</ref>}}
'''Gail McIntosh''' is an American artist primarily known for her [[Middle-earth Role Playing]] cover art, though she also created art for the [[Middle-earth Collectible Card Game]].<ref name=blackgate/>

==Career==
After studying at the Pennsylvania Academy of Fine Art and at the [[Italy|Italian]] ''Accademia di Belle Arti di Firenze'', she was an apprentice to sculptor [[Wikipedia:Antonio Berti (sculptor)|Antonio Berti]]. When she returned to the United State, she eventually ended up working for [[Iron Crown Enterprises]].<ref name=blackgate/>
